thread.title: Russell Westbrook feels like he made it after Kendrick Lamar rapped about him
thread.title_full: Russell Westbrook feels like he made it after Kendrick Lamar rapped about him

author: Kristian Winfield
title: Russell Westbrook feels like he made it after Kendrick Lamar rapped about him
text:
K-Dot rapped about the division between Westbrook and Kevin Durant.
Russell Westbrook was “surprised” and “happy” to hear his name in rapper Kendrick Lamar’s new single, “The Heart Part 4.” In fact, it’s not the NBA accolades that make the Thunder guard feel like he made it in life. It’s being referenced in Lamar’s song.
Russell Westbrook on getting mentioned on Kendrick's new song: pic.twitter.com/DIL64V0tZz 
— ㅤ (@GoatRapLines) March 26, 2017 “Yeah. K-Dot’s my man,” said Westbrook, when asked if he liked the new song. “Yes sir. That’s my guy, representing the west coast so I love it.
“I was surprised, I’m happy. You know whenever you hear your name in a song, you feel like you made it. I feel like I made it.”
The West Coast rapper dropped a new track last week, referencing the breakup between Westbrook and ex-teammate Kevin Durant . 
Lamar raps:
Tables turned, lesson learned, my best look/You jumped sides on me, now you 'bout to meet Westbrook/Go celebrate with your team and let victory vouch you/ 
Just know the next game played, I might slap the s... out you/ 
Durant left the Oklahoma City Thunder for the Golden State Warriors during free agency last summer. It was the Warriors who came back from a 3-1 deficit to eliminate the Thunder in last year’s Western Conference Finals.
